info.name: Product Demo
info.description: > Product Demo collections enable client-facing teams to easily demo API functions and use cases to potential customers. ## **ü™ê Get started** This collection serves as a resource for our internal teams to demo the Intergalactic Bank API to our customers and partners. It is expected that everyone using this collection is familiar with the basic concepts of the API, so the documentation is less instructional and more focused on highlighting the real-world use cases of the service. ## **üé®Visualize Results** The Bank Services team, from the fictional Intergalactic Bank, often demo APIs to a wide audience: there may be developers, analysts, project managers, and other roles on the call. Though everyone is invested in the value the API can bring, not everyone is familiar with reading data in JSON format. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve invested in creating _visualizations_, which can help consumers see how the data returned from the API might benefit their teams, or fit into their existing app. Be sure to check the Visualize tab for each request that contains ‚Äúvisualize‚Äù in its name. ## **üìùExample responses** When deciding to use our API, our customers need to understand what data gets returned and the format of that data. We‚Äôve documented many possible scenarios in our collection using **example responses**. This allows our team to walk through the different success and error responses for each request without having to change parameters to produce a response on the fly. ## **ü§ùCollaborate with us!** The Bank Services team wants your team‚Äôs input on our API demo. Do you have a use-case idea you think should be showcased here? Add an [inline comment](https://learning.postman.com/docs/collaborating-in-postman/working-with-your-team/discussing-your-work/) to this collection with your ideas, questions, and suggestions, or reach out to us on our internal Slack by tagging `@bank-services`.

item.name: Transactions

exec: • Use the search bar and sortable columns to filter transactions.

query.description: (Optional) filter for the account that initiated the transaction
(Optional) filter for the account that received the transaction
(Optional) filter for transactions created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves transactions for a given account, optionally filtering for transactions created on or after a date (`createdAt`), the account receiving the transaction (`toAccountId`) or the account initiating the transaction (`fromAccountId`).

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain an array of transaction objects matching the search criteria.

If no matching transactions are found, the transactions object will contain an empty array.

### Visualization

After sending the request, be sure to check out the visualization on this request by clicking over to the `Visualize` tab in the response pane.

query.description: (Optional) filter for the account that initiated the transaction
(Optional) filter for the account that received the transaction
(Optional) filter for transactions created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)
(Optional) filter for transactions created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)
(Optional) filter for the account that received the transaction
(Optional) filter for the account that initiated the transaction

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account where transactions originate from

response.name: Forbidden

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves details of a specific transaction by providing the transaction ID as a path parameter.

If you are looking to retrieve more than one transaction, check out the **List Transactions** request.

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain a single transaction object matching the search criteria.

If no transaction with the given ID is found, the request will return a `Not Found` error.

### Visualization

After sending the request, be sure to check out the visualization on this request by clicking over to the `Visualize` tab in the response pane.

response.name: Forbidden

request.description:
Creates a new transaction. You can transfer funds between accounts by providing two account IDs in the `fromAccountId` and `toAccountId` fields.

### Response

A successful request will contain a single transaction object with the newly created transaction `id`

If there are not enough funds in the originator's account to complete the transaction, the request will return a `400 Insufficient Funds` error.

### Important!

Transactions cannot be edited once created, so use this endpoint with caution.

response.name: Insufficient funds
Forbidden

item.description: A _**transaction**_ records money moving in or out of an account. Transactions at the Intergalactic Bank follow a blockchain-like approach. Once created, they cannot be updated or deleted. Use the **transaction** endpoints contained in this folder to... - List transactions \- get all transactions from an account, with options to filter by date, or the account they were delivered to. - Get a single transaction - If you are looking to retrieve information about a specific transaction, provide a transaction `id` and receive information about the transaction. - Create a new transaction - create a new transfer or deposit transaction for a given account. Transactions do not contain any information about the account balance. To inquire about account balances and other account-related details, please refer to the requests in the **Accounts** folder.

item.name: Accounts

exec: • Use the search bar and sortable columns to filter transactions.

query.description: (Optional) filter by full name of the account owner
(Optional) filter for accounts created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)

request.description:
List all accounts that exist at the the Intergalactic Bank. Optionally, filter by `owner` (using a full name), or filter for accounts created on or after a `createdAt` date (using `YYYY-MM-DD` format).

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will return an `accounts` object that contains an array of nested accounts matching the search criteria.

If no accounts are found to match the search criteria, the `accounts` object will contain an empty array.

### Visualization

After sending the request, be sure to check out the visualization on this request by clicking over to the `Visualize` tab in the response pane.

response.name: Successful Response

query.description: (Optional) filter by full name of the account owner
(Optional) filter for accounts created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)

response.name: Forbidden

request.description:
Get information about an account by passing the account `id` as a path parameter.

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain an `account` object matching the search criteria.

If no account with that ID is found, the request will return a `Not Found` error.

### Visualization

After sending the request, be sure to check out the visualization on this request by clicking over to the `Visualize` tab in the response pane.

response.name: Forbidden

request.description:
Creates a new account at the Intergalactic Bank.

### Request Body Properties

| Property Name | Property Type | **Description** | **Required?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| owner | String | Full name of the person opening this account | Yes |
| balance | Number | The starting balance of the account | Yes |
| currency | String - Possible values: `COSMIC_COINS`, `GALAXY_GOLD`, `MOON_BUCKS` | The currency this account will be using for transactions. This cannot be changed once established. | Yes |

### Response

A successful request will contain a single `account` object with the newly created account `id`

response.name: Forbidden

item.description: An Account at the Intergalactic Bank allows you to store funds. Use the _**account**_ endpoints contained in this folder to... - List accounts \- get all accounts that meet your search criteria. - Get a single account - If you are looking to retrieve information about a specific account, provide an account `id` and receive information about the account. - Create a new account - Create a new account Account endpoints do not return information about transactions. To retrieve transaction information, check out the requests in the **Transactions** folder.
